intro: Laphamia peninsularis, commonly known as the Peninsular lophotus, is a rare flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
